result.execSummary:
The defendant Maverick M King was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Negligent Operation of Motor Vehicle, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: I/S Sentence: 270 days jail, half in jail and balance on electronic monitoring, if eligible, and huber privileges. - stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay fines, costs, DNA surcharges. If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
All three counts expungement option if successfully completes probation.

timeConds.notes: Complete community service w/in 1 yr of probation with Portage Co Parks or Green Circle Trail.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Maverick M King
Current: 720 Polk Street, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 02-02-2017)
Prior: 2240 County Road II, Rudolph, WI 54475
Count 1, 2 & 3

3:10 p.m. Defendant Maverick M King in court with attorney Sheila Janelle Kessler. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Information has been filed and waived reading.
  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. Probation w/conditions.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: No Contest to all three amended counts.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Victim was notified and not present today.
ADA Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Kessler concurs with the joint recommendation, but requests no conditional jail time. 

BY THE COURT:***PROBATION***


Ct 1: I/S Sentence: 270 days jail, half in jail and balance on electronic monitoring, if eligible, and huber privileges. 1 day jail credit.
24 mo Probation,
Conditions:
 $100 fine + costs + DNA surcharges. 
Submit DNA sample. 30 hr community service w/in 1 yr of probation with Portage Co Parks or Green Circle Trail. 
No contact with Sidney Hartvig.
All three counts expungement option if successfully completes probation.

Ct 2: I/S Sentence: 270 days jailConcurent with count 1, same jail conditions. 24 mo Prob, concur same conditions and costs, DNA surcharges.
Ct 3: I/S Sentence: 270 days jailConcurrent with 1 & 2, same jail conditions. 24 mo Prob, concur same conditions and costs, DNA surcharges.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 19, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant Record Update
Pre-trial conference on April 4, 2016 at 10:00 am.

BY THE COURT:  No contact with David King is dropped.

Defendant Maverick M King in court with attorney Sheila Janelle Kessler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
3:50 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Preliminary hearing at 02-15-2016 03:00 pm

Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

11:29 a.m.  Court calls case
ADA Cousins appears in Court.  
DA Case No. 16PT36
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Cousins states facts for anticipated charges of 1st Degree Recklessly Endangering, Ciminal Damage to Property and Resisting or Obstructing an Officer.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.

State requests a $1,000.00 signature with conditions as stated.
Defendant informed to contact the public defender
